Agoraculture
ag·o·ra·cul·ture (ˈaɡrəˌkəlCHər/)
1. An exciting new way for you to discover and participate in community while supporting your local farmers.

ag·o·ra (/ˈæɡərə/; Ancient Greek: Ἀγορά)

1.(in ancient Greece) a public open space used for assemblies and markets. The Agora was a central spot in ancient Greek city-states, where people came together to participate in community, a place to share in the athletic, artistic, spiritual and political life of the city. Farmer's Markets are the modern Agora, where people can come together to meet each other and support their community of local farmers, as well as develop healthier and more intimate relationship with their food.

About Keith

Keith Van Emmeler is a Rails developer and an alumnus of the Flatiron School. Keith is passionate about building apps for social change. When he isn't writing code, he can be found following his curiosity and making new friends.

About Shawn

Shawn balls too hard and he needs to stop. No seriously, it's not fair to everybody else. Without Shawn this app would have been impossible.

About Agoraculture

We wanted to create an app that matches our values, namely community, healthy food, and sustainability. By aggregating information about local farmers markets, and conveniently displaying that information on a map, we hope that our users will find it easy and enjoyable to discover and participate in their communities, while taking pride in supporting local and sustainably produced food.

Built with Love

All of our apps are crafted with care, and we strive to make your experience as one of our users the best possible.
